website_summaries.verdict: The best entry-level cordless chainsaw, though it needs frequent charging.
pros: High-quality cordless chainsaw that’s great for small/medium gardens
cons: Small bar size, modest performance, moderate battery life

website_summaries.verdict: A powerhouse chainsaw that gets its strength from a chargeable lithium ion battery, providing more cuts per round than the competition.
pros: Battery will last about an hour, even with constant use
Chain oils automatically, removing the need to service manually
Easy to clean when routine maintenance is needed
They also feel it's relatively lightweight and quiet compared to other models
cons: When the battery is drained, it can take up to 45 minutes to re-charge
Tends to go through oil quickly

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Great chain saw, worth every penny. The biggest tree I have used this on was about 12 inches, took all day but this chain saw worked excellently. It eats through motor oil like it's going out of style, so be sure to have some nearby when using this. I have cut roughly 2.5-3 cords worth of wood and it's still holding up strong. The battery last about an hour with constant use and this didn't bother me because I already had another battery from B&D Hedge clippers, so I just kept changing them out. 1 year update, cut through about 15 trees, you can see how big they are in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like an angry beaver.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been wanting a chain saw for some time. I did not feel a gasoline saw would be safe for her and she always wanted to use mine. Iwheeeed to find a saw that was light, safer than gasoline saws, and had a long lasting battery. And I needed it in a price I could afford. So far this Black and Decker saw has worked great for her. It seems to have plenty of power and a long life battery. All the features I was looking for in a saw for her. Heck, I will probably grab this over my gas saw for medium sized jobs. That is if she will loan it to me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all the oil
customer_reviews.text: We have stihl chain saws and worxx chain saws but this is our first black and decker. We have a Lot of trees. Out of the box this and after charging the battery this saw had plenty of power to get quite large jobs done, and awesome run time on the charge. The saw is getting one star because it evidently has a major oil leak. At first we thought it was just going through oil, but actually it was leaking allover clothes of the cutter, the wood and wherever you sat the thing down. We hope to get it repaired under warranty. It is an auto oiler model with a 40 volt battery.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Oil doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews complaining about the automatic chain oiler not working. I decided to buy the chainsaw anyway. After a couple of uses the oiler didn't work. Called tech support and they sent a new filler cap with a plunger to manually oil the bar. It didn't work either. Now I get to send it to a support center for repair....not good. Amazon doesn't show an option to return it so I guess I'm stuck. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for very small branches
customer_reviews.text: My husband hated this saw. He tried to cut a 3- 3 1/2 " branch that fell and it took forever to get through. This saw is only for very small branches and nothing more. We have 3 big gas chain saws but he wanted something that he could zip through the small branches with. It's going back. It's much better to have a small gas powered saw than this. I read the description over and over and there was nothing mentioned about the size of the branches. If you want kindling, then this is the saw for you.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Leaks Oil Everywhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time researching electric chainsaws that would be used primarily for pruning and around the house purposes. Received my first one and was distraught to learn that it kept no oil and it pooled underneath the unit. Filled it the first night and by the second the oil reserve was empty. Returned it thinking that it must have been a bad unit. I was wrong. Second one came and only leaked about half the tank but upon firing up oil was shooting everywhere. I know that chainsaws have some oil seepage but this was like an oil gun. Ended up getting a refund and purchasing an EGo Chainsaw instead which actually works.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to cut up a fairly small dead tree that had fallen into the yard. First: midway thru first cuts it began to leak chain oil. This leak could not be found or stopped. It was only a 12” saw because it was not a large tree. Second: This thing is so underpowered that it is sad! I know battery powered can be less than great but all my other yard tools are battery powered and great. You would be lucky for this 40V to stay powered for 40 minutes. I have Black and Decker hedger and it is fine, not this chainsaw. It s returnable and Amazon is great so refund great but time wasted is not refundable
customer_reviews.author: Retired  Opera Singer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to use - bar tension knob would not loosen.
customer_reviews.text: As I now see in other reviews that is not an uncommon problem. I didn't have the nerve to go at it with a hammer so I did as I was advised by B&D support on the phone and returned it to Amazon. Very disappointed as I was looking forward to having a battery operated saw but I don't think I'll be willing to try it again.
customer_reviews.author: Shoreline shopper

customer_reviews.title: Only good for small trimming jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I incorrectly assumed that this saw would be as powerful and have torque similar to other brands I’ve used. I was wrong. It would be ok for trimming small branches but that’s all. I wanted to use it to trim small logs in my shop for turning on my lathe. It fails miserably at this task. There’s not enough torque and it drains the batter quick under load. I own the 40v lawn mower, string trimmer and blower. I got this because it uses the same battery. If it wasn’t too late to get a refund I would but I don’t have the packaging and it’s been over 3 months so I have a nice garage ornament. Lol
customer_reviews.author: James W. Daubney

customer_reviews.title: Returned !
customer_reviews.text: LEAKED OIL ! NEVER USED ! SHOULD HAVE READ ALL REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING ! THE OIL LEAK IS A KNOWN PROBLEM !
customer_reviews.author: Ed Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw for those fallen limbs and other small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw for those fallen limbs and other small jobs. Not meant to cut firewood all day long. It is a bit slower (chain speed) than my gas chainsaw so you need to be a little patient. But the convenience and light weight make up for the speed. I have 2 other B&D battery products (36 volt leaf blower and string trimmer) so this was a nice addition to the group. I'm told the 36 and 40 volt are interchangeable and I have seen no problems so far. I bought it at the right time as B&D had a free battery offer so it was $119 with the free battery. So far very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Oiler quits working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cutting up limbs trimmed off my apple trees. I really liked it but now after only cutting up limbs from 4 or 5 trees I noticed it wasn't using any oil. I cleaned out all the dust from chain and assembly it still doesn't discharge any oil. I drained oil and replaced with fresh but still wont work. I went from loving it to hating it in one morning. Good idea but pretty expensive for 2 months of ownership. Took it apart today and pump on oiler wont work. Don't waste your money. I'm going to try a Stihl and forget about black and decker They wont see another nickel from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A miniature beast
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little chainsaw. It's perfect for light duty around the yard. Cons: It guzzles oil like candy My battery easily lasted for half an hour when it was new. Two years later, I maybe get 10 minutes per charge. Pros: It cuts surprisingly well for how lightweight it is. It's also surprisingly durable for its weight. In the past couple years I've used this saw to cut down more than 10 trees that were over 6 inches in diameter, up to about 14 inches. I also used this saw to cut each of those trees into fireplace-sized logs. The tool-less chain operation took some getting used to, but works really well once you've figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rougemont

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasently surprised with this saw. For this review I think it's most helpful to see what I was able cut in one charge. See the attached pictures! The tree was about 12 inches thick at the stump with branches ranging from 6-8 inches. This chainsaw made easy work of them. By comparison, our landscaper wanted $500 to chop down this dying tree so this was a pretty good deal for me even if I never use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: small, easy to use, and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge branch come down after storm recently. it was probably 8 to 10 inches in diameter at the widest point. this little chainsaw cut through it like butter. I was able to cut it up into lengths and dispose of it with no problem. I'm really impressed. after all the cutting I did I still had 75 percent of the battery remaining. this is a great chain saw for small jobs. highly recommend. I did a Google search for the best oil to use for the chain and came up with this:
customer_reviews.author: J. Verville

customer_reviews.title: light duty battery chain saw
customer_reviews.text: starts first time. not for use on slim or small branches as slower chain speed causes chatter and bouncing on branch, on larger or more solid limbs it works just fine. we have trees not close enough to electric outlet and i did not want a heavy gas saw. my wife will use it as the weight is ok for her to manage. battery life is about an hour and charging takes 4 to 5 hours. be careful as the chain is very sharp..
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for fifteen minutes and then broke
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw carefully for not over fifteen mi utes cutting small willows a d then the tensioner knob stpped working. Took it apart and discovered that the bolt holding the tensioner knob was stripped. A standard sae bolt won’t work because b&d want to sell you one of there cheap, junk ones. I have every lne kf there electric battery tools so am really disappointed with this. I did not abuse or overtighten the tensioner and this have never happened. I will have to show this tool on youtu e to warn others away.
customer_reviews.author: butchosbox

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fine, but the oil drains from the reservoir.....store in a plastic tub
customer_reviews.author: Stuart O.

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have been bragging about this saw since I got it. I'm a 63 year old 5'4" woman and I use this to trim tree branches and small trees on my farm. It's light weight and battery outlasts me. Powerful too. SO worth the money .
customer_reviews.author: laurahow

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, we couldn't believe the trees we felled with this thing. No way, we thought, with an electric chainsaw. Wrong. Quiet, light weight, and really powerful. It eats oil so have plenty backup, but man is it worth it. The kid we hired to help clean up the 4x4 paths on our property had a blast with this thing. See photo attached. And, the paths are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: Only OK
customer_reviews.text: Another Battery is almost as expensive as the saw. I would not pay the price again for this saw. It is only OK in my opinion. The battery does not last very long and don't be surprised, mine takes a full 5 hours to fully charge. I refuse to pay the rediculous price for a second battery. I will live with the saw but it is not nearly as good as I thought it might be. After using it, I would opt for a very small lightweight gas powered saw.
customer_reviews.author: jD

customer_reviews.title: Does the job when the job isn't too much
customer_reviews.text: I use it to cut chunks for my smoker. Handles split and seasoned logs very well. I suppose it could handle anything you needed it to, but on a regular basis I'd stay under 4 inch diameter stuff. You have to use the chain rather than just lean into it like you can with a gas powered saw, but I'm old and delicate, so I don't do small 2 stroke pull starting anymore ;) I did use it to clean out a bunch of gum trees that had taken over a corner of my yard that has a bunch of stupid monkey grass in it. Way better than using hatchet or machete like I have in years past.
customer_reviews.author: hibankerjack

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little saw.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how many cuts I was able to make on a charge. I used this to demo a sundeck. I made cuts through 132 2x6 boards on a single battery charge. Anywhere and I was able to demo the entire deck into firewood on one charge. I think normal bar oil for a chainsaw is way too thin for this saw. I went to 135 weight gear lube that I had in the garage and it works fantastic by comparison, much less oil consumption and a much more appropriate amount of oil.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Great little homeowner saw
customer_reviews.text: For my light homeowner use this is a great product at this price point. I have taken down 3 small trees and trimmed countless branches with it and I'm very happy with the size, power and battery life. Probably the only negative is the chain oil. It will drain out while not in use. At first I thought something was wrong with it but its just gravity doing its thing. Now I drain whatever is left in the reservoir and keep a plastic tub under it when stored.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had never wasted my money on this saw
customer_reviews.text: Put oil in it and used it for the first time. It doesn't cut well at all when compared to my Stihl 170. It has a lot of kickback and just doesn't cut. I charged the battery which took about 3 hours and when I put it back in the saw, there was oil dripping from the bottom of the saw and from the chain. It leaks oil all of the time. I wish I had never wasted my money on this saw. Save yourself some money and just use a gas-powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: convenience
customer_reviews.text: This is a small light saw, but can cut wood much larger than you might expect, since a chain saw can cut directly into wood to the extent of the bar length. This battery- powered saw is adequately powered if you use it with care. It is good for any non-professional use which does not require extended routine use. I have used mine to cut logs up to 16 inch diameter. The self-oiler feature makes this model better than the model without it -- continuous oiling of the chain is essential. Be aware than chain saws are always oily and messy, something to remember when storing -- the oil leaks and drips.
customer_reviews.author: J. DeBruin

customer_reviews.title: Leaks bar oil bigtime - all the time.
customer_reviews.text: I had some midsize trees to cut, and this uses the same battery as my B & D trimmer. It works fine and would be top-rated but it leaks bar oil like a sieve. Be careful where you even set it down. I literally have to store it placed on an oil change pan. I am hoping I'll be finished with trees to cut before something breaks on it, then it'll just end up in a corner of my garage. I'll hope to remember to store it empty, but it'll probably still leave a puddle.
customer_reviews.author: DPD

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I love this easy to use chainsaw. It handles small to medium sized jobs great. While it eats oil pretty fast and it goes though batteries fairly quick (depending on tree size and hardness) its really a handy saw to have. We had a large silver maple taken down and we hand the crew leave all the wood in three feet sections. I ended up cutting it all in half for our neighbors to use. This chainsaw has done wonders. It's light, quiet, and cuts great. I'd recommend getting an additional 2.0 amp hour or better battery to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: Goemon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for size and price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to cut saplings and trunks of overgrown shrubbery. Lightweight and less noise than gas models (no fumes to inhale either.) Does not come with charger or battery, but I have other tools that use the same. The safety mechanisms are awesome, ladies. Always read the manual!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Just as other customers have called out, I have the same bar oil leakage problem with this product. Leaks oil as soon as the reservoir is filled, drips as the saw is being used, and leaks everywhere when stored. The reservoir totally drains out of oil. I had to wrap the saw in plastic after getting a large oil stain on my garage floor. B+D CS has not responded to any of my 4 emails regarding the problem. There is clearly a random quality/manufacturing issue with this model. I strongly recommend not buying this saw unless you are willing to risk getting a defective one as so many buyers have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: I was not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have a good Stihl gas saw but was looking for something lighter weight to be able to maneuver around Easley on my 10 acres for cutting small limbs and bamboo stalks. The song with bounce off of the bamboo stalks I had to hold it tight and push. My gas saw will slam right through it. this is actually more work for me because I had to hold it in place and push and it made it more effort than using my gas saw ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Linda M.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE SAW!
customer_reviews.text: First chainsaw I've ever owned. At 73, can't handle the large ones. Got this yesterday and cut broken limbs today. Worked as promised. My only advice is to check the oil level throughout your project. After about 20-30 minutes of cutting maybe a half dozen limbs or more, it needed to have oil added. Other than that, I have no complaints and would recommend it to anyone needing to do light work around the property.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Long

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but cautiously hopeful, that this saw would have enough "Oomph" to do what I bought it for; which was "light duty" compared to some of the other reviews I've read. Bottom line this tool exceeded my expectations, and more than validates paying a bit extra to go cordless versus a similar sized corded saw (gas was not an option for my situation). The BLACK+DECKER LCS1240 40V turned an all-day backyard job into a two hour job with plenty of charge left for more cutting. Yes it does go through the lubricating oil rather fast, but its automatically fed and a small price to pay for chain life; I love this saw.
customer_reviews.author: gnosisguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for this old lady...
customer_reviews.text: This tool works so well for me and is so easy to handle. It has great power , (from this old lady's perspective,) to get the job done, while not being too heavy for me to comfortably handle. The battery pops away from both the charger and the tool very easily when released. I've had great difficulty with similar batteries in the past ~ not being strong enough to make them release. I was so relieved to experience how easy this one is.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and power
customer_reviews.text: I have a B&D cordless weed whacker so chose this chainsaw since I already had the battery. Was a little concerned that some reviewers had issues with chain oil leaks. I have not. Very easy to adjust chain tension and add oil as needed. It slices thru cedar limbs with ease. I am a 70 year old woman and I use it to maintain paths on our property and clean up trees that are too heavy. It is nice and light and easy to control. We have a bigger more powerful chainsaw but this one is so easy to use we only use the regular one for big stuff ... Very pleased with this tough little chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowrider1950

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a champ, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: One million stars for this saw. REALLY easy to use, light, cuts like a champ! No hard starts, no stinky gas smell, just charge and go tear it up! This is some badass engineering right here. You want to clean it? Just turn that big dial, the whole side panel comes off. dust it out put it back together. 60 seconds. Changing the blade is easy (2 minutes), pouring oil in...easy. Easy, easy, easy...and it works soooo good! No, I'm not being paid or compensated for this review. It's just exciting to finally have something you can let sit for a year, charge and go. Just get it. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Davis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate, light and efficient power tool
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get away from pulling hard on a string to start a heavy chainsaw. This was the best solution. I have been using it for this winter, and so far it works flawlessly. On heavy use the battery will hold for about 20 minutes average. But it last longer for me because of moving the wood around or stacking the wood. You have to refill the chain oil reservoir, and it is see through so you can't forget. It auto feeds the chain oil.
customer_reviews.author: sir Charles

customer_reviews.title: Light saw—Has power
customer_reviews.text: This is the second saw—the first saw's battery "went bad" after two charges—rapidly flashing red light on charger. Amazon sent replacement saw since they can't just replace battery. This saw is easy to use—no starting hassles and is light weight and works fine on 10-12 inch thick trees and branches. I am ready to quit before the battery gives out on a full charge. If the battery doesn't fail, I'm quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Hanamizu

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to handle debris following hurricane Irma in Miami. While I realize that gas-powered are stronger and don't have the power limitations of a battery powered chainsaw, I felt this was better suited for me over time. First of all, it is plenty powerful to handle limbs and trunks up to about 8" in diameter. Second, as I have experienced with other gas-powered lawn equipment, if I don't use it frequently I often can't get it started when I need it. The size and ease mean that this is a much more valuable tool for me and will be used more often than a more cumbersome gas-powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil.  Big time.
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw today for the first time. Had a freshly charged battery and filled the oil tank. Set it on my tailgate after about 30 minutes of use and watched the oil puddle form. Then I looked down at my pants and saw the massive drips. Shame it makes such a mess when it's clearly a nice to have tool. My new strategy will be to use it, then let it sit in the weeds till it leaks itself empty. I still like it but geez.
customer_reviews.author: James Karr

customer_reviews.title: SURPRISING POWER, LIGHTWEIGHT, VERY USEFUL FOR HOMEOWNER
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased a B&D pole chain saw several years ago to use for trimming multiple trees (excellent but not lithium ion and ran down too fast), I decided to see whether the Lithium Ion products were superior as advertised. What a surprise. This saw cut through and trimmed for tying and disposal three large 10 inch oak limbs, cutting through them like butter. Much more powerful than expected, and the battery retains power until it runs down. I estimate that it ran 20 to 30 minutes. With two batteries you could do an hour's work. And there are additional well designed 40volt B&D products which use the same batter, including a blower/vac and hedge trimmer. I bought them all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is very light and easy to handle. The first battery discharge cycle was about an hour with off-on use cutting 4-6in logs & trimming. I had no kickback problems as others have reported and it did take a substantial amount of oil(filled three times during first discharge cycle). It is easy to clean and if you keep the area around the blade-case junction clear of sawdust, the auto-oiler seems to work consistently. I would recommend this as a lighter tool for around the yard jobs, not for deep forest log cutting.
customer_reviews.author: k a mckey

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this unit. It is quiet, does a very good job and can go anywhere. Electric units like this require virtually no maintenance. Just keep chain oil on hand. I do suggest you get a second battery if you are doing a lot of cutting or are cutting through large sections of wood. It can handle it, but will burn through your battery power faster than you might assume. I had a minor problem after about a year and took it to Black and Decker for repair. They sent me a brand new unit. Black and Decker is still a good product and remains a good company to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated lumberjack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, this will not fit a contractors need. However, I'm a typical home owner who has limbs that fall from time to time or windstorms will break limbs during the winter. For me... this is a perfect chain saw. I have bought the Stihl home owner brand which is also a nice machine... but if you don't want to go through the trouble of mixing gas and such, the Black & Decker is a great alternative. I would recommend this to any home owner with an average size property who has a few trees that need trimmed from time to time!
customer_reviews.author: Derrik

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Reliable, Handy
customer_reviews.text: I have only two complaints: it uses oil, and if the chain is overworked, it stops. Now, there are advantages to both of these: an under-oiled saw is a bigger pain, and a burned-up motor is a big bummer. I have used my saw to drop 16" D trees, and do all the trimming. Things: Get an oiler that has a narrow spout so you can push the oil into the reservoir. If you wear loose gloves, the glove may get caught in the release and stop the release from working. Keep a sharp chain. It's the best chainsaw I own.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I have two other chainsaws (a Stihl and a Husky Rancher) and hate starting and fooling with them so much that I end up using a hand treesaw half the time. So this little saw has made my life a lot easier. It's light, chain tensioning is easy, there's no ethanol/carburetor BS like you get with Stihls, and IT STARTS WHENEVER YOU WANT IT TO. Hooray! Do watch the oil level, and do be sure to recharge the battery after using it to extend life. But all in all, this is a giant leap forward for light- to medium-duty chainsaw work. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: lIGHT WEIGHT EASY TO HANDLE
customer_reviews.text: I am a 65 year old woman with arthritis in my hands and can use this saw with no trouble at all. I purchased this saw hoping it would be one that I could use around our acre and a half, and have to say it more than exceeds my expectations. I have taken down small tree's and pruned out branches easily. Very highly recommend, the 40 volt battery is the same as my B&D weed Wacker and I have yet to run out of power on any of the jobs done so far.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cruikshank

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered chainsaw but it stopped working. I don't need a chainsaw very often but when you need one you want it to work. I figured I would try a battery powered saw. This way it does not matter how much time goes by between uses. Just keep the battery charged. I have cut down two 6-9 inch trees so far and it did not need to be charged all day. I would like to buy a backup battery but there are so many aftermarket batteries out there it is hard to know which one is the right one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin

customer_reviews.title: it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is not a powerful saw. BUT, it works like a charm! I’ve cut a bunch of stuff...mostly small (1 to 2 in diameter), but also kinda large (5 inch diameter...hard woods). You just gotta treat it gently...let saw do the work. Chain oil is a pain but no big deal. Although the refill process is very slow due to dynamics of filling a small chamber with only one fill hole. I have 2 batteries, battery life great! I sold my 2cycle chain saw. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R.

customer_reviews.title: B&D 40v Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cutting saplings and branches. It works quiet well but you sould not be in a rush. It cuts soft wood fine but struggles a bit with thicker hard wood branches. You need one or two additional 40v batteries as a 20 minute length of battery operation seems normal. You also will not be able to recharge a battery until it cools down after use. Another issue is what seems to me to be high usage of chain saw oil. It is on for what I want to use it for and I also have a 40v B&D weedwacker that gives me the extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Goodwill

customer_reviews.title: Chews through small trees like an angry beaver.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is like an angry little beaver and eats through branches and small trees rapidly. Not only is this chainsaw fast but it's lite and easy to use and the battery life is good even when I was cutting up a large 9-10 inch diameter branch. The only downside and it's pretty minor is that it uses the chain oil very fast and you will need to keep an eye on it and fill it2-3 times or more per charge. This is only a minor issue since it seems most other electric chainsaws under oil which causes premature wear and reduces power.
customer_reviews.author: KRL

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, poor service
customer_reviews.text: The saw WORKS perfectly. It's light (compared to my 'garden' Stihl gas saw) and cuts fast. Alas, it developed an oil leak. After TRYING to get service and finding that the only factory service was a 2 hour drive from me, I tried to fix it myself. The saw was easy to take apart and I found the problem - a plastic hose hadn't been properly installed at the factory and slipped. Put it back together and so far so good, but not very happy with B&D service.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: oil leaks out of reservoir with no control over it
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing about this saw is that even when not in use, the oil will continue to leak as there is no on/off of the oil, essentially draining the oil reservoir dry when the saw sits in storage. I am apt to not fill the oil reservoir very much now as it makes a huge mess. Plan to store it in or on something plastic as oil will leak out and make a huge mess. If i had known this feature would happen I would not have gotten this saw. I would rather just spray on some oil when in use than fill the reservoir to the top and have it all come out when the saw isnt being used.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice Schick

customer_reviews.title: CHAINSAW LEAKS BAR & CHAIN OIL
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw works well in most conditions but battery life leaves alot to be desired. Don't plan on accomplishing any project that lasts more than 20 minutes. UPDATE: Chainsaw now leaking bar & chain oil big time.....sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN MURPHY

customer_reviews.title: This small saw is great, I have cut wood for over 40 years, and this saw is the berries for what is was made for!
customer_reviews.text: This saw so far has worked great, cuts well, is light and you do not have to breathe engine fumes. The battery life is good depending on how hard and long you use it, but keep a charged up spare on hand, and it will cut a lot of wood. I give it a thumbs up!! Plus you can tighten the chain very easy and quick, with no tools to mess with!
customer_reviews.author: hirembig

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean and it has taken down 10 '' ...
customer_reviews.text: no fumes, not too heavy, easy to clean and it has taken down 10 '' diameter trees for me. The charge seems to last a long time. it uses a lot of chain oil but it is the first chainsaw i have used so i don't know if that is normal or not. i previously (some time ago) had purchased the B&D 20V weed whacker and was not impressed but based on the reviews and not wanting another gas run thing, i tried this and it has been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: mkc

customer_reviews.title: maybe so in love with it
customer_reviews.text: Thought I had already reviewed this chainsaw, maybe so in love with it, forgot to do it. Perfect for an older woman, easy to handle, easy to use, the only thing I can think of that would be even better is someone else using it besides me <g> It does the job, have yet to run out of battery charge and use it heavily at times.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is TOUGH, let me tell you! Bought it to cut up a 60-foot long needle pine which fell over the winter before last. Buy at least 2 batteries, and maybe a 3rd, and you'll be good to go. By the time the batteries wear out, you'll be worn out. Just charge up the batteries and go at it again. It does go through a bit of oil, but even so, I cut the 60-footer with a bit of oil left from the quart I got for it. Yes, this is a good chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: M Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever
customer_reviews.text: I just used my new chainsaw today for first time. I love it. I bought a gas powered chainsaw last fall and could never start it even though it was an easy start one. I used my Black and Decker today for two hours cleaning out a fence row and still had battery left when I quit. I cut maple trees as big as my fist. Not a professional tree cutter by any means since I am over 60 and a woman. Just want to clean up around farm and don't want to wait for someone to start a chainsaw for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: just can't believe this product got so many good reviews
customer_reviews.text: Battery depleted in 5 mins, yes, only 5 mins after I fully charged it the whole last night. It worked on the first 2-3 cuts on the small branches, then getting very hard to cut the 15 inch tree lumber , battery light suddenly went red and the saw stopped working, just can't believe this product got so many good reviews
customer_reviews.author: LIANG ZHAO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light tasks.
customer_reviews.text: We live on 10 acres of juniper, cedar and pine covered desert in New Mexico and there is a lot of deadwood on the property that we plan to use in our fireplace this coming winter. This light-weight but very durable cordless chainsaw is perfect for getting our work done. It's quiet, easy to handle, and cuts through both dry and wet wood with ease. We can fill our wheelbarrow with 3-6" diameter, 24" long cuttings around 3 times before we need to change batteries. By then, WE need recharged ourselves! Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Oil leak
customer_reviews.text: Had this saw for a while and it worked fine. Just cut fallen limbs up. One day using it a lot, oil ran out of it all over except the bar. I decided to take it apart and the oil line from the pump to the bar was off. Put some small clamps on both ends of that hose and put it back together. It was easy for me. Now back to trimming just like new.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ebersohl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little saw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw about 4 months ago, I used it quite a bit getting logs for making aspen floor lamps. Now I am using it to get my winter supply of firewood. It's the most amazing little saw. I'm cutting aspen which is a soft wood but I am filling an old suburban with one battery every afternoon. The dead trees I'm cutting down are about 10 to 12 inches at the cut. Chain has never come off. Automatic oiler works perfectly. I am completely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not new obviously a return!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this chainsaw, when the chain is already installed obviously someone returned this “brand new” chain saw! The manufacturer does not deliver this chainsaw with chain installed. Needless to say the Bar adjust locking knob is completely jammed will not open, it is not lined up in position it arrived and therefore will not start!! Now I after putting in oil charging batteries will have return this great quality control!
customer_reviews.author: Carol R.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts okay but less than 5 min duration makes for very poor usability
customer_reviews.text: The saw cuts okay but the battery does not last. After charging the battery completely, I got through two 7" logs before the battery was exhausted. I charged it completely again, and got a little over two more cuts through a 7" log before it was dead. The saw also cut out/stopped when cutting and I'd have to pull the blade out, restart and enter the cut again. This happened several times. I called the service center and they said they hadn't received any calls on this model saw and suggested a bad battery. I am returning this saw and getting another to see if I got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Had to return mine before ever using it.
customer_reviews.text: My old 8 inch Black & Decker LCS120 has performed above and beyond expectation but I thought I'd upgrade and get the easier chain adjustment and automatic oiler. However, the black lock/unlock knob on the chain adjuster would not move. It's plastic and I didn't want to break it. After searching through questions and answers I saw that others had had the same problem. I returned it having never used it.
customer_reviews.author: Freeman P Thurston

customer_reviews.title: I could not be happier with this product
customer_reviews.text: It is rare that a product (particularly a battery powered product) exceeds expectations. I received this saw yesterday and have cut down some small poplars, an 8" pine tree, and an 8" oak tree and then cut them up for firewood - all on one charge. Charging time is about 5 hours, so If you need continuous cutting, you'll need an extra battery. The chain is very sharp and the chain keeps its tension. I haven't had to adjust the tension yet. It does not come with oil, so you'll want to order that at the same time. I could not be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine for a battery operated saw. One battery charge took down this Ash tree that was easily 60' tall and sectioned 3/4 of it up before the battery played out. I normally run big Stihl Pro saws and have to say I was really impressed with this little cutter. It's perfect for yard work, fallen limbs or even taking down a small tree as you can see from the picture.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of cutting power and battery does not run down too fast.
customer_reviews.text: I've used gas and electric chainsaws for many years, worn out more then I can count. I love this one for light work around the house. It is much lighter weight then my gas ones, and just a powerful. I cut two 10 inch limbs and 15 3" limbs and still had 60% battery life. It I safer also because it Is only running while in use, not sitting there idling all the time. I also will be taking it camping with me.
customer_reviews.author: Rickie Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Leaked oil
customer_reviews.text: Barely made it through one tree and it started leaking oil. I drips out both while in use and just sitting in the garage. Unfortunately, I waited too long to return it to Amazon. B & D says I can't bring it to a service center; I have to mail it at my expense for a "warrantee evaluation." Lesson learned, if you get a lemon, return it to Amazon ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this saw
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would not cut through much or the battery would die quickly, but neither is the case. I use it around my farm for clean up. Have cut limbs up to about 6 inches in diameter. Battery lasts longer than I expected it to. Totally recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Dani O.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on cutting in mesquite but drips chain oil
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding chain life cutting mesquite limbs up to 6 in thick. Using for landscaping, brush thinning work. Biggest complaint is chain oil tank design. Oil seems to run out more than properly oiling chain. Don't sit chainsaw down right side up. You'll wind up with big puddle of oil underneath. Dont fill more oil than needed for work time. Definitely don't fill to tank capacity or you'll waste oil just draining out underneath and on to any surface. Definitely an issue on clients walkway or in truck bed when working jobs. Otherwise, overall impressive performance and chain life.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You've GOT to have this saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Cut an ATV trailer full of wood last night, on 3 battery bars! Lightweight and easy to use. I have balance issues and this saw is easy for me to handle. I love the speed of cutting and the quick charge of the battery pack. One cycle of power is enough for this gal to get tuckered out anyway! Was a great Mother's Day gift from my daughter. Have another brand of corded saw and this is a great compliment to my cutting needs on the acreage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman and I can wield this pretty easily. It cuts hedges and small trees with ease. The battery life is good and it charges fast. The only downside is that it does use a lot of oil. I love this saw. I used it all summer to clean up the wooded lot behind my house.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil Constantly
customer_reviews.text: I filled the saw with oil and tank is empty in the morning. A little oil leak with a saw is understandable, but this is ridiculous. Used it chop up a fallen tree and very disappointed with cutting ability. Will return for a refund
customer_reviews.author: MDeran

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work and they won't back it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for little work around the house. The battery doesn't charge - I was only able to use it once. They're supposed to have a guarantee, but they don't back it. IF you can get ahold of them - which means hours of alternating between getting hung up on over the phone and getting random time-outs via chat - they'll give you the model number for the parts that don't work and tell you where to buy them. Product is trash, company is worse.
customer_reviews.author: Abhorel

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought one, has a lot of uses my Stihl can't do.
customer_reviews.text: Nice light chain saw. Use it if I don't want to break out the Stihl, which seems to be a lot. Also great for demo work on projects in the house where you don't want to use a 2 stroke gas powered one. It is light enough to climb a tree with for doing some limbing. Over all very happy with it. Won't replace a gas powered model but has other uses that the gas models can't do well either. I kind of look at it like a separate type of chainsaw. Bought this because I already had the 40V lawn mower and I am happy I did. It is also very quiet compared to my Stihl as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kazmania

customer_reviews.title: this chainsaw is fantastic for the light use I have put it through
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase an electric chainsaw. I had never owned a chainsaw and needed one for some quick tree limb issues. For the price, this chainsaw is fantastic for the light use I have put it through. It handled several 8" limbs without issue. The build construction seems very decent with a combination of quality plastics for the body and metals for the saw portion. The noise level is definitely less that what I have heard from gas chain saws. It does seem to go through oil pretty quick, but a small issue relative to continued, useful operation. I am extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Weilbacher

customer_reviews.title: UNUSEABLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Found the one that comes with a Battery... Unfortunately what they don't tell you is that it DOES NOT come with a battery charger... So now I have a saw and battery and no way to charge it. This is a joke. I hurried up and checked... Yes it does include a saw blade... Wow what a stroke of luck
customer_reviews.author: thomas welgosh

customer_reviews.title: Worked on small job but leaking oil
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it to cut up our Christmas tree and it worked well. He stored it in our garage and it is leaking oil all over the box he placed it on. I’m no expert in chainsaws but he isn’t very pleased with the oil issues. He said it did it’s job for the tree but that is the only thing he’s tried it on. Hoping to figure out the leaking oil problem.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but leaks oil like crazy.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this saw to do some clean up after Hurricane Irma. It cuts very well and is quite as well. But after 30 minutes of use, it leaks oil from the auto feed system when stored, and I mean leaks.
customer_reviews.author: BX

customer_reviews.title: Throw away the cords!  You won’t need them any more!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this cordless chain saw. It is easy to use, light weight, long extension and cuts great. We have many large live oaks in our yard that need constant trimming. This tool made that much easier and quicker. Also we have other Black and Decker tools that use the same battery, making additional tools much less expensive to add to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: L. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great for shrubs.. not logs..
customer_reviews.text: Well it cuts great when it’s running... But there’s some features that randomly stop it mid cut.. I read the manual and it says when too much pressure is applied, or the battery is dead. So I have two brand new 40v battery’s but they only last about 10min of cutting.. The saw stops after two cuts of a 8in diameter log and third cut it shuts off mid cut. So I change battery’s and it still does the same.. I even tried cutting using one hand to add slight pressure but it still shuts off mid cut.. not sure where the issue is..
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for home use
customer_reviews.text: I've been loving this unit and i used it for about 30 hours of cutting over 3 weekends. The chain is becoming duller but i really can't blame the product for the price. i used 3 batteries per day of working and besides having to reset the chain tension a few times it kept cutting and cutting. This unit saved me hundreds of dollars and I now have a great tool to add to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pfeil

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life & powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I have used my chainsaw several times, I didn’t need something heavy duty because I only use it to chop down tree limbs & then cut them up for fire wood/kindling. It’s perfect for light chore/home use, battery length & power ratio are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a bad arm and can't handle the heavy gas powered models. I am happy to say that this handles everything I need. I used it for over an hour (not constant cutting) on various size scrub trees and bushes and the battery didn't wear out (though I have a spare). It never slowed down and cut smoothly through the biggest stuff I threw at it - see the picture above of a 10 inch diameter autumn olive I took down.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new chain saw - so much better than having to plug in one or do the pull one. The battery life is great and can use the cordless blower and string trimmer. He has used to cut firewood and anything else he can find.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for my purpose; price was right
customer_reviews.text: We had 7 crepe myrtle trees that the previous owner had planted in generally very poor locations. In a word, they had to go. Cut them all down to a minimized stump on two charges of the very-powerful 40 amp battery, which I purchased separately. Very pleased with this chain saw -- it's not for the big boys, but is ideal for the occasional need and it can certainly handle tree stumps up to 6" in diameter with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Does what I want to do.
customer_reviews.text: Works as I expected. Used for trimming trees off of the ground and it is fine for that as long as I don't have too many at one time. Same problem as most battery powered devices, extra batteries are totally unreasonable to purchase. Can purchase another device with battery almost as cheap as extra battery alone. Makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen Farm

customer_reviews.title: very useful tool, but probably not for lumberjacks.
customer_reviews.text: Don't think this is a "real chain saw", it's electric. That's why it's light and clean, easy to use and not so frightening. I use it to keep trails clear and clean on 50 acres that I wish was mine behind my house so I can ride my mountain bike. It handles pretty large fallen trees pushing 12' without a problem. The battery is adequate for this kind of stuff, thought having a second chain is really helpful. I used canola oil rather than regular bar oil, it leaks a little but I haven't figured out exactly where yet. It's not much though and the unit comes with a blade cover that makes it kind of a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: High accolades for this handy chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this chainsaw for pruning well established fruit trees. I was very pleased with its capacity for the clean up of massive tree limbs that came down in our last bout of heavy snow. The battery life always seems to last as long as my energy level. I get a break when it gets a break (recharging). Works for me! 😍
customer_reviews.author: APB

customer_reviews.title: The unit's light weight makes it easy to handle and maneuver
customer_reviews.text: While nowhere near as capable as a gasoline powered chainsaw, this battery powered unit works extremely well. I've cut 14 inch limbs with little effort. The battery provides 30-45 minutes of actual cutting time, depending on the workload. The unit's light weight makes it easy to handle and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs well for cutting up large tree limbs.
customer_reviews.text: Had some down tree limbs from a storm and needed to take care of them. This 40V battery saw did the trick. I bought the hedge trimmer so I could have two batteries. I wore out before the saw did. Photo shows what I was able to get done. This saw was able to handle up to 10" willow tree limbs. The chain oil dispenser feature is nice and easy to use. Same for the blade adjustment. Not the saw you want if you are doing this full time but perfect for the homeowner with a few trees on their property that need attention.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I've used corded Black and Decker chainsaws. There great for cutting jobs around the home. Purchasing the 40volt Max chainsaw seemed chancy. I can tell you that this little chainsaw has all the power I need. One bit of advice, get an extra 40v battery and have a lot of chain oil at hand. Give it a try
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Older Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Really not bad at all. It does burn through bar oil rather quickly but does the job it's designed for. In the photo, the top shelf of wood is what I got off 1 charge and had to fill the bar oil once after the first fill, which is now nearly depleted after one battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. I sawed a locust tree that came down from a storm this spring. Sawed it in 2 foot sections in a very fast time and only used half the battery life. I have the Black and Decker weed trimmer and the leaf blower, so I expected this saw to preform like the others and it didn't let me down. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: shug1

customer_reviews.title: Impressive saw
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is amazing. We like to camp in the winter so getting firewood quick and easy is a must. This saw is light enough to carry but aggressive enough to cut a truck full of wood in under an hour. With constant use, the battery lasts roughly 45 minutes which isn't bad. The oiler definitely isn't frugal with the oil but to the flip side, nothing will rust or run dry. Disassembly for cleaning is a snap out in the field and the tensioning is easy peasy. If I had the need, I'd buy two of these.
customer_reviews.author: VKSheridan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: For a battery operated saw it works very well. Don’t think that it’s going to be as powerful as a gasoline model but for working around the yard it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this lightweight chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Black and Decker chainsaw to cut down several trees since getting it in 2019. I purchased an additional battery and was glad I did, as the original battery would not charge properly. I contacted Black and Decker customer support a few weeks back and they send me a new battery. I received it and it is charging properly. I can cut down and cut up most of a 10" diameter pine tree on one battery charge.
customer_reviews.author: Toby7

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for light use
customer_reviews.text: It was real time saver after the major snowstorm when several smaller trees fell under the load. Probably not suitable to cut very thick wood, but did not have much problem with 6" branches for me. Saves time and money since you can do trimming and cleanup yourself rather than call someone, then wait and pay. Make sure you read the safety section in the manual!
customer_reviews.author: MikeA

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 40V Max Cordless Chainsaw, 12-Inch (LCS1240)
product_meta.description: Style:40V Chainsaw KitThe BLACK+DECKER LCS1240 12" 40V Cordless Chainsaw features a 40V MAX Lithium Ion Battery for longer runtime and overall life - it stays charged up to 5x longer. It has a 12" Oregon low-kickback bar and chain which provides smooth and fast cuts. The tool-free chain tensioning allows for quick and easy chain adjustments, and it also features a lightweight design for ease of use and maneuverability. The automatic oiling system ensures constant bar and chain lubrication, and the wrap around bale handle provides increased control and comfort. The standard charger provided will charge a fully depleted battery in about 4-5 hours. 1. Plug the charger into an appropriate outlet before inserting the battery pack. 2. Insert the battery pack into the charger. 3. The green LED will flash indicating that the battery is being charged. 4. The completion of charge is indicated by the green LED remaining on continuously. The pack is fully charged and may be used at this time or left on the charger. Included Components: Battery Charger Bar + Chain Scabbard; Power Source: Cordless
